comment: foreign language classes are difficult on their own, professor park makes it fun to learn! there is a lot of homework and tests are heavily lecture-based, but she creates an environment to feel comfortable practicing your skills and always helps when you ask for it. she is very witty, too, so you'll never be bored!

Holy cow, there is so much homework, there is a homework assignment for every single day of the week, there are textbook assignments you must complete once a week as well, also you have to purchase an online course to do more homework every week which is always due at 10am. On top of that you have to buy a textbook. Good luck...
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lots of homework--Test heavy

comment: She is a great professor. Learning Korean is a lot easier when you are comfortable to speak out loud and she definitely makes this possible in her class. She is funny and is always willing to help. Prepare for weekly homework and the workbook. Overall, not too much work and not extremely difficult.

Considering that it is a language class there is a lot of homework, but she asks for feedback on how to make the class more digestible. She is very sweet there and allows redos on homework assignments for a better grade; easy oral exam, group and individual project throughout the semester. take her you wont regret it; study vocab and grammar points
rating_tags: Group projects--Gives good feedback--Lots of homework

comment: She is the absolute sweetest and makes learning Korean so easy and digestible. Highly recommend. Definitely be prepared to talk and participate in class, she will make you speak as it is necessary to learn any language.
Lots of work but that's kind of necessary for a language class. She really cares about her students and teaching.

Super nice professor, there's an exit ticket in which you need to say a sentence in Korean about what you learned. There's lots of reinforcement work, you actually need the textbook since you will do textbook exercises. There's a media presentation, vocab log, and two group projects (skit and final project, only two people). Only ONE oral exam!
